p: Sri Lanka is an island country located in the Indian Ocean, between 5°54′ and 9°52′ north latitude and 79°39′ and 81°53′ east longitude, with an approximate area of 65,610 km 2. Topographically, the country is divided into three peneplains [ 40]. The mountainous region located in the south-central part of Sri Lanka rising above 2500 m is surrounded by broad lowland plains [ 41]. The climate of Sri Lanka is generally tropical and warm; however, a wide variation can be observed across the country due to the differences in rainfall and elevation [ 41]. Sri Lanka is endowed with diverse vegetation types mainly due to variations in topography, climate, soil and also coastal influence [ 42]. The unique and diverse ecosystems have provided habitats for rich species diversity and genetic variability among species [ 41]. Out of the total land area of the country, nearly 35% is reserved for conservation purposes [ 40] and around 40% is utilized for agriculture [ 43].
